Posted By: Majinkajisan (7/10/2013 9:55:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Possible repeated removal, card advantage, deck thinning (so you hopefully draw less lands), discard fodder, reliable land drops with less land in the deck, and a nice way to get out giant Demons in casual, or huge [Drain Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drain Life)s. Consider [Throne of Geth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Geth) and [Grim Affliction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Affliction) to T5 her ultimate, you can do this at instant speed, leaving 2 lands untapped as well as your swamp from last turn untapped; giving you 12 mana to drop on whatever you feel. T5 with 12 {B} is a powerful thing in the right deck. To make it reliable have your backup plan be [Crypt Ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Ghast) for 10 {B}.  
  
This is planeswalker is so Timmy it's awesome.  
  
Even if she's usually a slow [Tithe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tithe), she can be pretty useful just for making your deck reliable in the late turns of the game.
posts.html:

T5 with 12 {B} is a powerful thing in the right deck. To make it reliable have your backup plan be Crypt Ghast for 10 {B}.

This is planeswalker is so Timmy it's awesome.

Even if she's usually a slow Tithe, she can be pretty useful just for making your deck reliable in the late turns of the game.

posts.post_content: This is the only planeswalker I own, not because shes amazingly good but b/c shes the only one not amazingly expensive to buy. Her abilities are 'ok' but honestly 4 mana for a planeswalker that comes into play with only 3 loyalty and only generates +1 loyalty a turn? She should have either cost 3 mana, or her first ability should be +2, or she should come into play with 4 loyalty... pick any of those.

Posted By: Syrtees (10/24/2013 9:56:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The amount of times Swamp is printed on this card clearly indicates this is to be a true Mono-B planeswalker. Yet, there is actually a top tier Mono Black deck (top 8 at PT Theros!) in Standard and this card still sees no play.  
  
Its effect is very little in any game. The removal aspect is too expensive to be considered really repeatable (this is a 4 mana Quag Sickness if you play it and -3 it immediately and if you take a turn to +1 it, it takes 2 turns to kill 1 creature and at least 3 more turns to kill a 2nd, assuming it never gets hit). The swamp searching thins your deck a bit, ensures you hit land drops, not that exciting for a 4 mana Planeswalker. The ultimate gives you what exactly? A lot of mana for the rest of the game on turn 7, assuming you cast this turn 4 and +1 every turn and also have it never take a hit. Not really that good without a great mana sink, which black doesn't really have.  
  
A lot of small functions on one card has been a formula for solid, playable cards bef... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
The amount of times Swamp is printed on this card clearly indicates this is to be a true Mono-B planeswalker. Yet, there is actually a top tier Mono Black deck (top 8 at PT Theros!) in Standard and this card still sees no play.

Its effect is very little in any game. The removal aspect is too expensive to be considered really repeatable (this is a 4 mana Quag Sickness if you play it and -3 it immediately and if you take a turn to +1 it, it takes 2 turns to kill 1 creature and at least 3 more turns to kill a 2nd, assuming it never gets hit). The swamp searching thins your deck a bit, ensures you hit land drops, not that exciting for a 4 mana Planeswalker. The ultimate gives you what exactly? A lot of mana for the rest of the game on turn 7, assuming you cast this turn 4 and +1 every turn and also have it never take a hit. Not really that good without a great mana sink, which black doesn't really have.
